review: Easy install, easy setup and I love the remote and Android application.  I was up and running in minutes.I don't think I'll miss the voice search of the Amazon Fire TV, but we'll see how that goes.  Picture quality is fantastic.

review: Yes, it takes a little getting used to how to use it , but, I have a Chrome stick, Sony player, blue-ray player, and Wii  which I have used for streaming and the picture quality with this is noticeably crisper and clearer and less buffering which I was getting even with my 50mbps connection.  I do wish it would work with Serviio for streaming videos from my PC but Plex gets the job done.
author: Timothy L Lyssy

review: My FireTV stick arrived earlier than advertised, and it's bumped my power-hungry PS3 for streaming duties.Installation was simple: My TV has a USB port (an LG 50PJ550, it claims the port is for service diagnostics only, but it works) so I didn't need to use the included adapter.  The power adapter itself is a nice bonus, it's Kindle Fire-compatible (standard USB micro B cable) so I got a free tablet charger out of the deal.  In setting up my wifi I found it supports 802.11ac, so my fancy new router is getting put to use.  Nice!As for apps, Amazon Instant Video / Prime content is given center stage, but Netflix/Hulu/etc. are all easily accessible.  I wouldn't shy away from this if you're not a Prime customer.  The Amazon Instant Video app is more usable than the PS3's, and the Netflix app is pretty much identical as well.Video looks good, I couldn't tell any difference to my PS3's output aside from a bit of jitter/lag for the first few seconds the first time I watch a series or movie.My only concern is that the remote feels a bit insubstantial - all of the weight is at the bottom, so it has a bit of a hollow feeling in your hand.  Not a huge concern, but worth mentioning. You can use your phone a la Chromecast if the remote isn't your thing.Also, Amazon has finally figured out product packaging.  It's really pretty, if that matters to you.
author: Gidget

review: AWESOME! Answer to my streaming needs. I have both an Apple TV and the Fire Stick. I love the Fire Stick because it streams Netflix, Hulu AND Amazon Prime!
author: TeacherT

review: Working out great as a streaming media player for the bedroom. All our main machines (xbox, ps3, wii) are in the living room with the BIG tv. We didn't want to move any of those to the bedroom but wanted a cheap and easy not to mention small solution for streaming to our non-smart LG tv in the bedroom. We wanted to it to stream Netflix AND Amazon so Chromecast was out. I've used Roku before and I thought their menu design was clunky.The Fire Stick is a breeze to set up, easy and intuitive to use and works perfectly. Plus, it's cheap! That's a lot of entertainment and value in such a small package!

review: I don't like how easily it can charge your credit card, especially when "Prime" content is mixed with content you have to pay for.
author: ed

review: I got my Fire Stick during the early special for Prime members, and it's been some of the best money I've spent in ages.  I had woefully underused my Netflix subscription, as well as Showtime app, since I don't like watching on a tablet/laptop, and hooking a device up to the TV each time is a pain.  (Lazy, perhaps, but true.)  I'm not a big techie, but The Fire stick came synched to my Prime account, and was easy to get onto my home Wifi and linked to Netflix and Showtime.  I've already started a couple of new series, have greater access to movies, and more on-demand kids' content for my toddler.  And with HBO GO coming in early 2015, it will only get better.  Awesome purchase.
author: Julie
